title: Desperation to attack killed Australia but superb Jordan Petaia and other young talents can thrive under new coach
text:
Michael Cheika's first Rugby World Cup campaign with Australia was such a glorious run to the final against the odds. There was no glory four years on in Oita.

Cheika might not have enjoyed the line of questioning afterwards regarding his future as head coach but it was only pertinent to ask. Saturday's limp effort marked the end of the Wallabies' recent decline, having won only 47 percent of their matches in this four-year cycle.

"Mate, I will will be honest, it is a cruel, cruel world nowadays when you are asking that question two minutes after we've been knocked out of the World Cup," Cheika exclaimed.

"And if you find it inside you, to find a little bit of compassion for people who are hurting,...
description: Michael Cheika's first Rugby World Cup campaign with Australia was such a glorious run to the final against the odds.
